LayoutNode.Content: A Special Track of the Twenty-Fifth Conference on Artificial Intelligence
LayoutNode.SRC: A Special Track of the Twenty-Fifth Conference on Artificial Intelligence

LayoutNode.Content: December 1, 2010 – February 1, 2011: Authors register on the AAAI web site
LayoutNode.SRC: • December 1, 2010 – February 1, 2011: Authors register on the AAAI web site

LayoutNode.Content: April 15, 2011: Notification of acceptance or rejection
May 3, 2011: Camera-ready copy due at AAAI office
LayoutNode.SRC: • May 3, 2011: Camera-ready copy due at AAAI office

LayoutNode.Content: Integration across multiple components of intelligence is required over the long term to achieve the AI grand challenge of developing computational systems capable of general human-level intelligence - and possibly beyond - whether such systems take the form of software agents, robots, or virtual humans. It is also critical in the shorter term to solve many complex, real-world problems.
LayoutNode.SRC: Integration across multiple components of intelligence is required over the long term to achieve the AI grand challenge of developing computational systems capable of general human-level intelligence - and possibly beyond - whether such systems take the form of software agents, robots, or virtual humans. It is also critical in the shorter term to solve many complex, real-world problems.

LayoutNode.Content: The Integrated Intelligence track presents papers that describe significant integrations of two or more components. Significance here is a function of both the set of components being integrated and the approach taken to their integration. One part of this function focuses on novelty, with respect to both the component set and the integration approach. A second part focuses on impact. Does this integration yield important synergies not previously achieved? Does the integration approach provide value added beyond previous approaches, if any, to integrating comparable components? The final part focuses on evidence; and, in particular, on how compelling the evidence, whether theoretical or experimental, is for the claimed impacts.
LayoutNode.SRC: The Integrated Intelligence track presents papers that describe significant integrations of two or more components. Significance here is a function of both the set of components being integrated and the approach taken to their integration. One part of this function focuses on novelty, with respect to both the component set and the integration approach. A second part focuses on impact. Does this integration yield important synergies not previously achieved? Does the integration approach provide value added beyond previous approaches, if any, to integrating comparable components? The final part focuses on evidence; and, in particular, on how compelling the evidence, whether theoretical or experimental, is for the claimed impacts.

LayoutNode.Content: Relevant component technologies include but are not limited to: the following:
LayoutNode.SRC: Relevant component technologies include but are not limited to: the following:

LayoutNode.Content: Natural language processing, dialogue and interaction

Papers will be reviewed by qualified reviewers drawn from a special track committee, with specific expertise in the above areas, as well as the general AAAI program committee. Submissions to this special track deemed not to be relevant may be considered for review for the general technical papers track at the discretion of the track and conference cochairs.
LayoutNode.SRC: Papers will be reviewed by qualified reviewers drawn from a special track committee, with specific expertise in the above areas, as well as the general AAAI program committee. Submissions to this special track deemed not to be relevant may be considered for review for the general technical papers track at the discretion of the track and conference cochairs.

LayoutNode.Content: Authors must register at the AAAI-11 Integrated Intelligence Special Track web-based technical paper submission site. The software will assign a password, which will enable the author to log on to submit an abstract and paper. In order to avoid a rush at the last minute, authors are encouraged to register as soon as possible after December 1, and well in advance of the February 3 abstract deadline.
LayoutNode.SRC: Authors must register at the AAAI-11 Integrated Intelligence Special Track web-based technical paper submission site. The software will assign a password, which will enable the author to log on to submit an abstract and paper. In order to avoid a rush at the last minute, authors are encouraged to register as soon as possible after December 1, and well in advance of the February 3 abstract deadline.

LayoutNode.Content: Registration will close at 11:00 PM PST on February 3, 2011.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Registration will close at 11:00 PM PST on February 3, 2011.

LayoutNode.Content: Abstract submission will close at 11:59 PM PST on February 3, 2011.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Abstract submission will close at 11:59 PM PST on February 3, 2011.

LayoutNode.Content: Final paper submission will close at 11:59 PM PST on February 8, 2011.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Final paper submission will close at 11:59 PM PST on February 8, 2011.

LayoutNode.Content: Electronic abstract and paper submission through the AAAI-11 special track paper submission site is required on or (preferably) before the deadline dates listed above. We cannot accept submissions by e-mail or fax.
LayoutNode.SRC: Electronic abstract and paper submission through the AAAI-11 special track paper submission site is required on or (preferably) before the deadline dates listed above. We cannot accept submissions by e-mail or fax.

LayoutNode.Content: Papers must be in trouble-free, high resolution PDF format, formatted for US letter (8.5" x 11") paper, using type 1 or TrueType fonts. Papers may be no longer than 6 pages including references, and formatted in AAAI two-column, camera-ready style (see the author instructions page). Please note that these formatting instructions are for final, accepted papers; no additional pages can be purchased at the review stage. In addition, the copyright slug may be omitted in the initial submission phase. Please also refer to the blind-review webpage for instructions on how to prepare your paper for blind review.
LayoutNode.SRC: Papers must be in trouble-free, high resolution PDF format, formatted for US letter (8.5" x 11") paper, using type 1 or TrueType fonts. Papers may be no longer than 6 pages including references, and formatted in AAAI two-column, camera-ready style (see the author instructions page). Please note that these formatting instructions are for final, accepted papers; no additional pages can be purchased at the review stage. In addition, the copyright slug may be omitted in the initial submission phase. Please also refer to the blind-review webpage for instructions on how to prepare your paper for blind review.

LayoutNode.Content: Authors will receive confirmation of receipt of their abstracts or papers, including an ID number, shortly after submission. AAAI will contact authors again only if problems are encountered with papers. Inquiries regarding lost papers must be made no later than February 15, 2011.
LayoutNode.SRC: Authors will receive confirmation of receipt of their abstracts or papers, including an ID number, shortly after submission. AAAI will contact authors again only if problems are encountered with papers. Inquiries regarding lost papers must be made no later than February 15, 2011.

LayoutNode.Content: Submissions to Other Conferences or Journals: Papers submitted to this conference must not have been accepted for publication elsewhere or be under review for another AI conference. The guidelines of the AAAI policy on multiple submissions are fully detailed below and must be carefully followed.
LayoutNode.SRC: Submissions to Other Conferences or Journals: Papers submitted to this conference must not have been accepted for publication elsewhere or be under review for another AI conference. The guidelines of the AAAI policy on multiple submissions are fully detailed below and must be carefully followed.

LayoutNode.Content: Review Process: Program committee members will identify papers they are qualified to review based on the information submitted electronically (the paper's title, keywords, and abstract). Their reviewing will be done blind to the identities of the authors and their institutions.
LayoutNode.SRC: Review Process: Program committee members will identify papers they are qualified to review based on the information submitted electronically (the paper's title, keywords, and abstract). Their reviewing will be done blind to the identities of the authors and their institutions.

LayoutNode.Content: Authors will have a limited opportunity to respond to initial reviews. This author's feedback may then be taken into account in the final reviews and recommendations. The program committee's reviews will make recommendations to the track cochairs. Although the track cochairs will formally make all final decisions, in practice almost all will be made earlier in the process.
LayoutNode.SRC: Authors will have a limited opportunity to respond to initial reviews. This author's feedback may then be taken into account in the final reviews and recommendations. The program committee's reviews will make recommendations to the track cochairs. Although the track cochairs will formally make all final decisions, in practice almost all will be made earlier in the process.

LayoutNode.Content: Publication: Accepted papers will be allocated six (6) pages in the conference proceedings. Up to two (2) additional pages may be used at a cost to the authors of US$ 275 per page. Final papers exceeding eight (8) pages and those violating the instructions to authors will not be included in the proceedings. Authors will be required to transfer copyright of their paper to AAAI.
LayoutNode.SRC: Publication: Accepted papers will be allocated six (6) pages in the conference proceedings. Up to two (2) additional pages may be used at a cost to the authors of US$ 275 per page. Final papers exceeding eight (8) pages and those violating the instructions to authors will not be included in the proceedings. Authors will be required to transfer copyright of their paper to AAAI.

LayoutNode.Content: AAAI-11 Policy Concerning Submissions to Other Conferences or Journals
LayoutNode.SRC: AAAI-11 Policy Concerning Submissions to Other Conferences or Journals

LayoutNode.Content: Papers submitted to this conference must not have been accepted for publication elsewhere or be under review for another AI conference. (The AAAI Nectar paper submissions have specific guidelines that can be found in that call for papers.)
LayoutNode.SRC: Papers submitted to this conference must not have been accepted for publication elsewhere or be under review for another AI conference. (The AAAI Nectar paper submissions have specific guidelines that can be found in that call for papers.)

LayoutNode.Content: To encourage interdisciplinary contributions, AAAI will consider work that has been submitted or presented in part elsewhere, if it is unlikely to have been seen by more than a few members of the AAAI audience. As such, papers may not be dually submitted to other AI or AI subarea conferences. Papers under submission to a journal that contain overlap with AAAI papers will be considered as long as the author specifies the dual submission and certifies that the journal submission contains significant material that is not included in the AAAI submission. Papers that have been published in full in another conference or journal will not be accepted for review. Novelty is an important criterion in the selection of papers.
LayoutNode.SRC: To encourage interdisciplinary contributions, AAAI will consider work that has been submitted or presented in part elsewhere, if it is unlikely to have been seen by more than a few members of the AAAI audience. As such, papers may not be dually submitted to other AI or AI subarea conferences. Papers under submission to a journal that contain overlap with AAAI papers will be considered as long as the author specifies the dual submission and certifies that the journal submission contains significant material that is not included in the AAAI submission. Papers that have been published in full in another conference or journal will not be accepted for review. Novelty is an important criterion in the selection of papers.

LayoutNode.Content: Authors must specify the conferences and journals to which the paper has been dually submitted.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Authors must specify the conferences and journals to which the paper has been dually submitted.

LayoutNode.Content: Authors must withdraw papers under review or accepted for other AI conference venues if the paper is submitted to AAAI.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Authors must withdraw papers under review or accepted for other AI conference venues if the paper is submitted to AAAI.

LayoutNode.Content: Papers not dually submitted should so indicate on the title page.
LayoutNode.SRC: <LI>Papers not dually submitted should so indicate on the title page.

LayoutNode.Content: For questions as to whether a given meeting is considered under the dual submission policy, or for clarifications of this policy, submitters should contact the Program Chairs.
LayoutNode.SRC: For questions as to whether a given meeting is considered under the dual submission policy, or for clarifications of this policy, submitters should contact the Program Chairs.
